article_title: Oklahoma City Bombing Recalled as Day of Agony and Strength
article_text:
Survivors and officials Sunday marked the 20th anniversary of the Oklahoma City bombing, an act of domestic terrorism that exposed the country’s vulnerability to future mass violence.

An antigovernment extremist, Timothy McVeigh, was convicted of detonating a 4,000-pound fertilizer bomb hidden in a Ryder rental truck parked outside the Alfred P. Murrah Federal Building on April 19, 1995. The blast killed 168 people, including 19...
